required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation in the Rehabilitation of Postoperative Motor Dysfunction.
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation in the Rehabilitation of Glioma Patients With Postoperative Motor Dysfunction.

brief_summary.textblock: This study focused on glioma patients with postoperative motor deficits, especially for patients with supplementary motor area syndrome. The investigators want to investigate whether the recovery of motor function will be accelerated by using transcranial magnetic stimulation to stimulate primary motor area and supplementary motor area on the lesional hemisphere.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: patients with postoperative motor deficits, especially for patients with SMA syndrome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the day of tumor resection to 3 months after tumor resection.
primary_outcome.description: The ratio of motor functional recovery in patients with TMS treatment is higher than those do not receive TMS treatment and the time of motor funcitonal recovery is shorter than those do not receive.

intervention.description: Using TMS to stimulate (5 Hz, 90%~110% resting motor threshold) patients' primary motor area and SMA.

facility.name: Beijing Neurosurgical Institute and Beijing Tiantan Hospital

reference.citation: Dionísio A, Duarte IC, Patrício M, Castelo-Branco M. The Use of Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation for Stroke Rehabilitation: A Systematic Review. J Stroke Cerebrovasc Dis. 2018 Jan;27(1):1-31. doi: 10.1016/j.jstrokecerebrovasdis.2017.09.008. Epub 2017 Oct 27. Review.

Lefaucheur JP, Aleman A, Baeken C, Benninger DH, Brunelin J, Di Lazzaro V, Filipović SR, Grefkes C, Hasan A, Hummel FC, Jääskeläinen SK, Langguth B, Leocani L, Londero A, Nardone R, Nguyen JP, Nyffeler T, Oliveira-Maia AJ, Oliviero A, Padberg F, Palm U, Paulus W, Poulet E, Quartarone A, Rachid F, Rektorová I, Rossi S, Sahlsten H, Schecklmann M, Szekely D, Ziemann U. Evidence-based guidelines on the therapeutic use of repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS): An update (2014-2018). Clin Neurophysiol. 2020 Feb;131(2):474-528. doi: 10.1016/j.clinph.2019.11.002. Epub 2020 Jan 1. Review. Erratum in: Clin Neurophysiol. 2020 May;131(5):1168-1169.

patient_data.ipd_description: The treatment protocal of TMS for glioma patients with postoperative motor dysfunction
